blueprint.description: Includes common files used across different types of common file repositories (e.g. Go, Python, TypeScript, Go, more..)
blueprint.name: Shared Common
blueprint.overview: This repository feeds downstream repositories that store programming language specific common files. When this repository is updated, the changes are propagated downstream via CI. This repository contains files that are meant to be global. For instance, if Go projects and Angular projects share a common file (say `.editorconfig`, for example) then that file is stored in this repository and propagated to the Go and Angular common file repositories. Then, for example, the Go common file repository is included in all of the Go projects as a submodule. This is meant to be done with every repository in an eco-system so that meta files, documentation, etc. are all kept in sync.
blueprint.title: Shared Common Files

descriptions.build: Builds the project using the build command specified under scripts in package.json
descriptions.help: Display the Bodega Taskfile.yml interactive help menu
descriptions.prepare: A hook triggered by running npm install that runs logic such as installing pre-commit hooks
descriptions.repair: Fixes basic issues in projects that are having trouble running basic commands like 'task start'
descriptions.start: Entrypoint for new developers that installs requirements and then runs 'task start'
descriptions.test: Runs the appropriate test logic by running the test command defined under scripts in package.json
